content.question: Each of the following figures shows three identical capacitors connected to a battery. Which arrangement has the greatest equivalent capacitance?

choices.label: The figure presents a rectangular circuit with an additional vertical branch in the middle connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The rectangle’s left side has a battery, the right side has a capacitor, and the middle branch has a capacitor. To the right of the middle branch, the rectangle’s bottom side has a capacitor.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with an additional vertical branch in the middle connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The rectangle’s left side has a battery, the right side has a capacitor, and the middle branch has two capacitors in series.
The figure presents a rectangular circuit. The left side has a battery, and the top, right and bottom sides each have one capacitor.
The figure presents a rectangular circuit. The left side has a battery, the top side has a capacitor, and the right side has two capacitors in parallel.

The figure presents a rectangular circuit with an additional vertical branch in the middle connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The rectangle’s left side has a battery, the right side has a capacitor, and the additional branch has two capacitors in parallel.

content.answer: The figure presents a rectangular circuit with an additional vertical branch in the middle connecting the top and bottom sides of the rectangle. The rectangle’s left side has a battery, the right side has a capacitor, and the additional branch has two capacitors in parallel.
